page.title: 04ST.PETER'S CHURCH, BENINGTON
page.content: (Part 2) In the CHANCEL are the tombs of Sir Edmund de Benstede (d.1432) and Joanna, Sir John (d.1359) and his wife Petron- illa (Moyne) (d.1378) and other commem- orative descriptions. The chairs date from 1600. In the 14th century CHAPEL is depicted the figure of a king with a sword thrust through his body. This may represent the murdered King Edward II. A burial vault under the chapel may contain the final remains of the first de Benstede, and was used again in the 18th century by the Chesshyre family. The present Chapel altar was used as the main altar in 1800. (Cont.)
